item.title: Abandoned Santander bike near no 95, 8th June
item.description:
There's a Santander bike leaning against a tree near no.95 Lennard Road. It's in a very bad state and looks like it's been dragged out of a river. Been there longer than a week.

item.title: Smelly Drain, 8th June
item.description:
Outside our house 10 Leinster Mews there is a drain that smells. The smell comes up through our house most days and if we have our windows open, the smell comes in. Its a very strong smell.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Leinster Mews, Paddington, London

item.title: Litter strewn along street. No litter bins., 8th June
item.description:
Litter in consistently an issue. Please can litter and dog foul be collected more regularly? And please can litter bins be considered? I don’t think there is a single litter bin on Hartington Road. Without bins or more cleaning, the situation is unlikely to improve. I note that the estates between Hartington and Wandsworth Road have numerous litter and dog foul bins so I’m insured why Hartington Road has none?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 128, Hartington Road, Stockwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unlawful add & destroyed fences that keep blowing away creating hazards, 8th June
item.description:
This property fence keeps being damaged by the wind, creating wood panels to frequently fall down becoming trip hazards on the pavement. This has been for months. Recent advertisement panel added, has it been legally authorised? Thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rectory Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Pavement not accessible, 8th June
item.description:
The thick overhanging brambles mean we have to walk in the road . This pavement is well used and main route to the school the opposite pavement often has council worker vans loading . Would be good to cut it back . Is it legal for anyone to do it ?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charnwood Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 16 Rugby Street, 8th June
item.description:
A lamp post was damaged and replaced The stump of the old lamp post is still in situ many months on. It's unsightly and has been reported - many weeks ago now We were assured by the crew who replaced the lamp post that the stump would be removed - 6 months ago. We're having a summer fair on 21 June - please can you get rid of this eyesore that we look at every day? Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Emerald Court, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Speeding down North Wharf Road, 8th June
item.description:
North Wharf Road is a one-way, long stretch of communal road, and its lack of speed bumps has effectively turned it into a playground for reckless drivers. This is especially concerning given that it is a residential area — people live here, and the constant speeding not only poses a serious safety risk but also causes disruptive noise throughout the day and night. Just the other day, I saw a motorbike perform a wheelie down the road. A few months ago, my mum was nearly hit by a group of boys speeding in an Audi while she was trying to cross. Installing speed bumps would be the most effective solution — they’re already in place on wider roads nearby, so it makes no sense that they haven’t been implemented here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, North Wharf Road, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet
